extensions.name: accesskit
extensions.title: AccessKit
extensions.details: Provides accessibility tools for XKit and your dashboard, such as increased font sizes, more contrast on icons and more.

extensions.name: activity_plus
extensions.title: Activity+
extensions.details: This extension brings a couple of tweaks for the Activity page, such as the ability to filter notes by type and showing timestamps.

extensions.name: alternative_timestamps
extensions.title: Alternative Timestamps
extensions.description: Adds timestamps to dashboard posts using a parsing method
extensions.details: This version of Timestamps uses parsing methods to display the timestamp instead of AJAX calls. Currently only in English.

extensions.name: anti_capitalism
extensions.title: Anti-Capitalism
extensions.description: Removes sponsored posts, vendor buttons, and other nonsense that wants your money.

extensions.name: april_fools
extensions.title: April Fool's
extensions.description: Brings back various jokes Tumblr did for April 1st
extensions.details: Brings back Framed Avatars, AOL Instant Messenger, and The Missing E from 2018's Tumblr April Fools.

extensions.name: audio_downloader
extensions.title: Audio Downloader
extensions.description: Lets you download audio posts hosted on Tumblr
extensions.details: This extension allows you to download audio posts as MP3 files on your computer. Please note that it only works on audio hosted on Tumblr. If they were posted from Spotify, SoundCloud, YouTube or any other service, it won't work.

extensions.name: autoloadimages
extensions.title: Auto Load Images
extensions.details: This extension removes the "gray box" that appears on the photos attached to non-photo posts, allowing the photos to load automatically without you having to click on them.

extensions.name: autoscroll
extensions.title: Auto Scroll
extensions.description: Scrolls the page at a variable pace.
extensions.details: Automatically scrolls the dashboard.

extensions.name: auto_tagger
extensions.title: Auto Tagger
extensions.details: This extension allows you to automatically add tags to posts based on state (reblogged, original, queued) or post type (audio, video, etc) and keeping original tags while reblogging a post.

extensions.name: blacklist
extensions.title: Blacklist
extensions.details: This extension allows you to block posts based on the words you specify. If a post has the text you've written in the post itself or it's tags, it will be replaced by a warning, or won't be shown on your dashboard, depending on your settings.

extensions.name: people_notifier
extensions.title: Blog Tracker
extensions.details:
Blog Tracker lets you track blogs like you can track tags. Add them on your dashboard, and it will let you know how many new posts they've made the last time you've checked their blogs, or if they've changed their URLs.

Please be aware that the more blogs you add, the longer it will take to track them all.

extensions.name: bookmarker
extensions.title: Bookmarker
extensions.details: The Bookmarker extension allows you to bookmark posts and get back to them whenever you want to. Just click on the Bookmark icon on posts and the post will be added to your Bookmark List on your sidebar.

extensions.name: old_notifications
extensions.title: Classic Notifications
extensions.details: This is a very experimental extension that brings back the notifications to your blog pages (ie: www.tumblr.com/blog/new-xkit-extension), just the way it was before Tumblr's Activity update.

extensions.name: disable_search
extensions.title: Classic Search
extensions.details: This is a very simple extension that simply redirects your search requests to the old Tumblr tag search pages. Note that features of the new search page, such as multiple tag search will not work when this extension is enabled.

extensions.name: cleanfeed
extensions.title: CleanFeed
extensions.details: This extension, when enabled, hides photo posts until you hover over them. Useful to browse Tumblr in a workspace or in public, and not worry about NSFW stuff appearing. You can also set it to hide avatars and not show non-text posts at all. To activate or disable it, click on the CleanFeed button on your sidebar. It will remember it's on/off setting.

extensions.name: colorquotes
extensions.title: Color Quotes
extensions.description: Color Quotes has moved to Reblog Display Options

extensions.name: convert_links
extensions.title: Convert Links
extensions.details: This extension allows you to turn the 'encrypted' links that people can send you using asks to clickable ones.

extensions.name: disable_gifs
extensions.title: Disable Gifs
extensions.details: This is a very early preview version of an extension that allows you to stop the GIFs from playing on your dashboard. If you still would like to view them, you can click on the Play button on the post. Please note that for now, this extension can't stop GIFs added to text posts.

extensions.name: edible_reblogs
extensions.title: Edible Reblogs
extensions.details: ...with our priorities in order. Puts bread in literally everything.

extensions.name: editable_reblogs
extensions.title: Editable Reblogs
extensions.description: Restores ability to edit previous reblogs of a post

extensions.name: elevator
extensions.title: Elevator
extensions.description: Scroll to top the old-fashioned way
extensions.details: Makes the scroll to top button scroll slowly and play elevator music.

extensions.name: shuffle_queue
extensions.title: Enhanced Queue
extensions.details: Go to your queue and click on the Shuffle button on the sidebar to shuffle the posts. Note that only the posts you see will be shuffled. If you have more than 15 posts on your queue, scroll down and load more posts in order to shuffle them too. Or click on Shrink Posts button to quickly rearrange them.

extensions.name: find_blogs
extensions.title: Find Blogs
extensions.details: Requires User Menus+ to be installed.

extensions.name: find_inactives
extensions.title: Find Inactives
extensions.description: Find the inactive blogs you follow
extensions.details: This extension lets you find blogs that haven't been updated in a certain amount of time. Just go to list of blogs you follow, then click on "Find Inactive Blogs" button below your Crushes to get started.

extensions.name: fresh_prince
extensions.title: Fresh Prince
extensions.details: This extension flips everything on the dashboard. Don't expect Tumblr to function correctly whatsoever while this extension is installed.

extensions.name: glowing_follow
extensions.title: Glowing Follow
extensions.description: Glowing plusses on non-mutual followers' blogs
extensions.details: Makes the Follow button on people's blogs glow if they are following you and you are not following them. Before proceeding, please keep in mind that sometimes, ignorance is bliss.

extensions.name: go_to_dash
extensions.title: Go-To-Dash
extensions.description: View a post from a blog on your dashboard or sidebar.
extensions.details: This extension adds a 'view' button on people's blogs that allows you to go back to that post on your dashboard or sidebar. Viewing on dashboard only works on the blogs you follow, and may fail if the post dates to before you followed them.

extensions.name: classic_header
extensions.title: Header Options
extensions.details: This extension adds your blogs on the top of the page, so you can easily switch between blogs. The blog limit on the header is five, but you can limit this to three blogs and turn off the blog title bubble from the settings.

extensions.name: lethe
extensions.title: Hermes
extensions.description: Helps speed up your Tumblr experience

extensions.name: hideavatars
extensions.title: Hide Avatars
extensions.description: Hides avatars on a per-url basis

extensions.name: highlighter
extensions.title: Highlighter
extensions.details: The cousin of Blacklister, this extension highlights posts depending on the words you decide. When a word you add is found on a post, the post will get a yellow-ish background.

extensions.name: icon_nots
extensions.title: Iconified Notifications
extensions.details: This extension replaces words like 'reblogged your post' with an icon, making notifications easier to notice and frees up space for the post summary.

extensions.name: jk_across_pages
extensions.title: J/K Across Pages
extensions.description: Allow Tumblr's J/K navigation to move between pages

extensions.name: limit_people
extensions.title: Limit People
extensions.description: Limit the appearance of blogs on dash
extensions.details: Some people on your dashboard posting a lot? Limit people limits how many consecutive posts by the same person appear on your dashboard at once. If a user makes more than 2 consecutive posts, the rest will be hidden until you click on a button to show them.

extensions.name: mass_deleter
extensions.title: Mass Deleter
extensions.details: Used to mass unlike posts or delete drafts. Please use with caution, especially Mass Unlike part is extremely experimental.

extensions.name: mass_plus
extensions.title: Mass+
extensions.details: This extension allows you to select multiple posts by once, by type or month. It also comes with visual enhancements for the mass post editor, such as selected post count and more!

extensions.name: messaging_tweaks
extensions.title: Messaging Tweaks
extensions.details: This adds a few helpful tweaks to the Tumblr IM, for example minimising the chat, hiding the IM icon or changing the looks of the chat window.

extensions.name: mirrorposts
extensions.title: Mirror Button
extensions.description: A button to easily backup posts
extensions.details: This extension provides a button that will create a mirror of a post on either archive.org or archive.is

extensions.name: mute
extensions.title: Mute!
extensions.details: This extension allows you to hide text and answer posts by an user while still seeing their other posts. Useful if a blogger has nice posts but a bad personality. Please note that you'll need to re-mute them if a user changes their URL.

extensions.name: mutualchecker
extensions.title: Mutual Checker
extensions.description: A simple way to see who follows you back
extensions.details:
Adds a small icon and '[user] follows you' hovertext to URLs you see in post headers (when appropriate).

Only checks the URL when the person directly made/reblogged/submitted/published the post, and doesn't work on sideblogs.

extensions.name: norecommended
extensions.title: No Recommended
extensions.details: This extension removes recommended posts from your dashboard. To remove Recommended Blogs on the sidebar, please use Tweaks extension.

extensions.name: notificationblock
extensions.title: NotificationBlock
extensions.details: One post got way too popular and now just annoying you? Click on the notification block icon on that post to hide the notifications from that post. If you have Go-To-Dash installed, you can click on a notification, then click View button on top-right corner to quickly go back to the post on your dashboard.

extensions.name: notifications_plus
extensions.title: Notifications+
extensions.details: This extension replaces both XPreview and Only Replies extensions of XKit 6. Using this, you can hover over notifications to get post notes, and toggle the option that dims non-reply notifications.

extensions.name: one_click_postage
extensions.title: One-Click Postage
extensions.description: Lets you easily reblog, draft and queue posts

extensions.name: one_click_reply
extensions.title: One-Click Reply
extensions.details: To use this extension, hover over a notification and click on the Reply button. If Multi-Reply is on, hold down the ALT key while clicking on the Reply button to select/deselect posts and reply to all of them at once.

extensions.name: open_in_new_tabs
extensions.title: Open In Tabs
extensions.description: Changes links to open in new tabs
extensions.details: Open In Tabs allows you to open links on new tabs, useful if you don't like being confined to one tab. Since some links, if opened in new tabs, can break functionality, they are not effected by this extension.

extensions.name: outbox
extensions.title: Outbox
extensions.description: Saves your sent replies and asks.
extensions.details: This extension stores and lets you view the last 50 asks you've answered privately. Please keep in mind that this is a highly experimental extension, so if you hit a bug, please send the XKit blog an ask with the problem you've found.

extensions.name: panaroma
extensions.title: Panorama
extensions.details: This extension extends your dashboard to fit the screen. It this an experimental extension, and no support for it provided yet.

extensions.name: pokes
extensions.title: Poks
extensions.details: Randomly spawns Pokmon on your dash for you to collect.

extensions.name: postarchive
extensions.title: Post Archiver
extensions.details:
Post Archiver lets you save posts to your XKit.

Found a good recipe? Think those hotline numbers on that signal boost post might come in handy in the future?

Click on the save button, then click on the My Archive button on your sidebar anytime to access those posts. You can also name and categorize posts.

extensions.name: post_crushes
extensions.title: Post Crushes
extensions.description: Lets you share your Tumblr Crushes
extensions.details: To use this extension, go to the 'Following' page on your dashboard, and click on the 'Post My Crushes' button below your Tumblr Crushes.

extensions.name: post_limit_checker
extensions.title: Post Limit Checker
extensions.description: Are you close to the limit?
extensions.details: Shows you how many posts you can reblog today.

extensions.name: postblock
extensions.title: PostBlock
extensions.description: Block the posts you don't like
extensions.details: This is an experimental extension that blocks posts you don't like on your dashboard. When you block a post, it will be hidden completely, including reblogs of it.

extensions.name: profiler
extensions.title: Profiler
extensions.details:
Select Profiler option from the User Menu to see information such as when they started blogging, how many posts they have, timezone, and more.

Requires User Menus+ to be installed.

extensions.name: quick_tags
extensions.title: Quick Tags
extensions.details: Allows you to create tag bundles and add tags to posts without leaving the dashboard.

extensions.name: read_more_now
extensions.title: Read More Now
extensions.details: This extension allows you to read 'Read More' posts without leaving your dash. Just click on the 'Read More Now!' button on posts and XKit will automatically load and display the post on your dashboard.

extensions.name: read_posts
extensions.title: Read Posts
extensions.details: Dims the posts on the dashboard that you've already seen on previous page loads.

extensions.name: better_reblogs
extensions.title: Reblog Display Options
extensions.description: Adds different styles to the new reblog layout, including the "classic" nested look.

extensions.name: replyviewer
extensions.title: ReplyViewer
extensions.details: The close relative of TagViewer, this extension allows you to see what replies, answers and additional content added to it while reblogging on any post.

extensions.name: satsukimous
extensions.title: Satsukimous
extensions.details: This extension is a prime example of what happens when you let JavaScript developers stay up past midnight.

extensions.name: scroll_to_bottom
extensions.title: Scroll To Bottom
extensions.description: Scroll to the bottom of long lists, like the post queue.

extensions.name: search_likes
extensions.title: Search Likes
extensions.details: This is a very experimental extension that lets you search the posts you've liked by URL or text. Just go to your likes page, then click on Search button to get started.

extensions.name: separator
extensions.title: Separator
extensions.details: A simple extension that puts a divider showing where you left off on your dashboard.

extensions.name: servant
extensions.title: Servant
extensions.details: Automator for XKit: lets you create little Servants that does tasks for you when the conditions you've set are met.

extensions.name: shorten_posts
extensions.title: Shorten Posts
extensions.details:
This extension shortens long posts, so if you are interested, you can just click on Show Full Post button to see it all, or scroll down if you are not interested. Useful for screens where long posts take a lot of space, and making it hard to scroll down.

By default, this extension shortens text posts. You can toggle settings to choose which types of posts to shorten. (This will 'cut off' long, vertical posts.)

extensions.name: show_originals
extensions.title: Show Originals
extensions.details: This is a really experimental extension allows you see original (non-reblogged) posts made by users on your dashboard. Please keep in mind that if you don't have enough people creating new posts on your dashboard, it might slow down your computer.

extensions.name: show_picture_size
extensions.title: Show Picture Size
extensions.description: Shows the resolution of media post pictures in the upper right corner of the picture

extensions.name: soft_refresh
extensions.title: Soft Refresh
extensions.details:
This extension allows you to see new posts on your dashboard without refreshing the page. When you get the New Posts bubble, click on the Tumblr logo, and new posts will appear on your dashboard.

If you still want to refresh the page completely (perform a Hard Refresh), hold the ALT key while clicking on logo and the page will refresh.

Please note that this extension is highly experimental, and might not work properly all the time.

extensions.name: tag_replacer
extensions.title: Tag Replacer
extensions.details: Allows you to bulk replace tags of posts. Go to your Posts page on your dashboard and click on the button on the sidebar and enter the tag you want replaced, and the new tag, and Tag Replacer will take care of the rest.

extensions.name: classic_tags
extensions.title: Tag Tracking+
extensions.description: Shows your tracked tags on your sidebar

extensions.name: tagviewer
extensions.title: TagViewer
extensions.details:
This extension allows you to see what tags people added to a post while they reblogged it. It also provides access to the post, and to Tumblr search pages to find similar posts.

Based on the work of inklesspen

extensions.name: theme_editor
extensions.title: Theme Editor
extensions.details:
If you are good with CSS, hop in and make your own theme.

When installed, this extension disables the standard Themes extension, and adds a button on your sidebar on your dashboard that lets you write and load your own theme. When you are done, you can submit it to xkit-dev.tumblr.com so it can be added to the theme gallery.

This extension is not recommended for people without CSS/HTML experience and only provided for XKit theme developers. Please disable Themes and Yoohoo! extensions before using. For better editing, Textarea Code Formatter for Chrome or Tabinta for Firefox is recommended.

extensions.name: themes
extensions.title: Themes
extensions.details: This extension allows you to install themes from the XKit Theme Gallery onto your dashboard. New themes are added regularly, and if you are good with CSS, send an ask to xkit-dev.tumblr.com to get your theme added here!

extensions.name: themes_plus
extensions.title: Themes+ (preview)
extensions.details: Themes+ lets you customize your dashboard to your liking by letting you choose the colors, the images and options yourself. You can also export and import the themes you and others made. Please note that this is the preview edition, so it's lacking some functionality.

extensions.name: timestamps
extensions.title: Timestamps
extensions.description: See when a post has been made.
extensions.details: This extension lets you see when a post was made, in full date or relative time (eg: 5 minutes ago). It also works on asks, and you can format your timestamps.

extensions.name: tf2_reblogs
extensions.title: Tumblr Fortress 2
extensions.description: Replaces reblog icons with TF2 kill icons

extensions.name: tweaks
extensions.title: Tweaks
extensions.description: Various little tweaks for your dashboard.
extensions.details: These are small little tweaks that allows you customize your dashboard. If you have used XKit 6, you will notice that some of the extensions have been moved here as options you can toggle. Keep in mind that some of the tweaks (the ones marked with a '*') can slow down your computer.

extensions.name: unreverse2
extensions.title: Unreverse
extensions.description: Places the post buttons on top
extensions.details: This extension places the reblog/like/reply/etc buttons on the top of the post. It is unsupported, and might cause problems with your dashboard. Please use with caution.

extensions.name: show_more
extensions.title: User Menus+
extensions.description: More options on the user menu
extensions.details: This extension adds additional options to the user menu (the one that appears under user avatars on your dashboard), such as Avatar Magnifier, links to their Liked Posts page if they have them enabled. Note that this extension, especially the Show Likes and Show Submit options use a lot of network and might slow your computer down.

extensions.name: vanilla_audio
extensions.title: Vanilla Audio
extensions.description: Adds an alternative audio player to audio posts.
extensions.details: This extension adds a native HTML5 audio player to every audio post, with an option for the default volume and the ability to loop the audio.

extensions.name: vanilla_video
extensions.title: Vanilla Videos
extensions.details: Use the browser's native video player. Only affects Tumblr's player.

extensions.name: view_my_tags
extensions.title: View My Tags
extensions.description: Lets you view your recently used tags

extensions.name: view_on_dash
extensions.title: View On Dash
extensions.details: This is a preview version of an extension, missing most features due to legal/technical reasons for now. It lets you view the last 20 posts a person has made on their blogs right on your dashboard. If you have User Menus+ installed, you can also access it from their user menu under their avatar.

extensions.name: xcloud
extensions.title: XCloud
extensions.details: XCloud stores your XKit configuration on New XKit servers so you can back up your data and synchronize it with other computers and browsers easily.

extensions.name: xinbox
extensions.title: XInbox
extensions.details: XInbox allows you to tag posts before posting them, and see all your messages at once, and lets you delete multiple messages at once using the Mass Editor mode. To use this mode, go to your Inbox and click on the Mass Editor Mode button on your sidebar, click on the messages you want to delete then click the Delete Messages button.

extensions.name: xkit_installer
extensions.title: XKit Installer
extensions.description: Lets you install XKit on your computer.

extensions.name: xneko
extensions.title: XNeko
extensions.details:
A free spirited Japanese cat for your dashboard.
It is based on the Neko application by Kenji Gotoh.

extensions.name: stats
extensions.title: XStats
extensions.details: This extension allows you to view statistics regarding your dashboard, such as the percentage of post types, top 4 posters, and more. In the future, it will allow you to view statistics regarding your and others blogs.
